page.title: 01Introducing Dalgety Bay
page.content: Dalgety Bay is a small town of about 6000 inhabitants. It is situated on the northern shores of the Firth of Forth approximately twelve miles from Edinburgh,Scotland's capital.It is primarily a residential area,a large majority of the houses being owner occupied.The majority of people of working age commute to jobs in Edinburgh,Dunfermline and Kirkcaldy with a small proportion of the local inhabitants employed in the two industrial estates , mostly high technology industries,situated on the outskirts of Dalgety Bay. A number of local inhabitants are employed at the Braefoot Bay oil and gas tanker terminal which serves the Mossmorran petrochemical complex nearby.
